text: hi my name is Rebecca and today we're
going to talk about the difference
between two little verbs and they are
bring and take now you might be
wondering that these seem to be pretty
basic verbs so why the confusion well
there shouldn't be but sometimes there
is and even in fact in the country where
I am in Canada sometimes there is a
little bit of confusion between these
two basic verbs so let's understand what
the difference is okay when you say to
someone bring that to me right bring
that book to me you are saying you're
asking them to bring something towards
you to bring something in your direction
all right so brain always implies or
means in a certain direction in the
direction of the speaker all right now
the other word take is the opposite so
take implies away from take this away
from me I don't like the smell for
example okay please take it away from me
so when you say take it away it means in
a direction away from the speaker
alright so that's the main difference so
we see that green is going towards the
speaker take is away from the speaker
right let's look at some other examples
please bring me a glass of water could
you please bring me a glass form right
or a teacher might say to his students
please bring your essays to class
tomorrow
that means from their home to the class
to the place where she is where she's
speaking from please bring your essays
to class right let's look at the next
one please don't forget to take your
books home with you
take your books home means take your
books away from this place right or
don't forget to take your gloves with
you it's really cold outside tonight
don't forget to take your gloves with
you again take your gloves and go away
from the speaker all right
simple little lesson but by making these
small little changes in the way you use
English step by step you'll be speaking
better English all right
if you have any other questions please
feel free to write to us at wwe.com
thanks very much bye for now
